ground_truth: Denethor continues with his meal as Faramir exits. High above Minas Morgul, on a small ledge next to the stairs, lie Frodo, Sam, and Gollum. Sam watches a sleeping Gollum suspiciously as he desperately tries to stay awake, but slowly, inevitably, Sam falls asleep. Gollum's eyes snap open, he sits up, and quietly crawls towards Sam's knapsack. Sam breathes deeply now, heavily asleep. Gollum grimaces in distaste as he pulls out the lembas bread and quietly sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam before throwing the remaining lembas bread over the cliff. Sam's eyes flick open and Gollum spins around, caught off guard. Too exhausted to argue, Sam turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder. Sam rummages through his knapsack, looking for a bite to eat, but stops rummaging, shock on his face, and slowly turns to Gollum. Gollum slaps his hand against Sam's jacket, sending lembas crumbs raining down. Sam is enraged, throws himself at Gollum, and punches him. Frodo pulls Sam off Gollum and collapses on the ground, with Sam's horrified face showing. Sam attempts to fuss around Frodo, but a terrible light comes into Frodo's eyes as he stares into Sam's earnest eyes. Frodo pushes Sam away, clutching the ring beneath his shirt, and rises to his feet as if empowered with a frightening intense energy. Sam stares at Frodo with disbelief, tears well in his eyes, and spill down his cheeks as Frodo turns and leaves with Gollum. Sam is in complete misery. Meanwhile, Faramir leads a column of 200 knights through the streets towards the city gate, with people rushing forward, throwing flowers over the knights. Gandalf hurries alongside Faramir's horse, reading the pain in Faramir's eyes, and calls after him, trying one more time to stop the young man. From a high angle, Faramir leads the 200 mounted knights through the gates of Minas Tirith and across the Pelennor Fields towards the ruins of Osgiliath as the people of Minas Tirith watch. Faramir's knights fan out to form one straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his men watch them approach. Suddenly, fast pushing into Pippin, who looks on as Denethor eats, Gothmog rises amidst the ruins. Faramir's knights thunder towards the camera, 75 yards away, and Gothmog turns to camera and raises his hand. Behind Gothmog, 5,000 Orc archers rise to their feet, black arrows already strung on their bows. Faramir yells defiantly, but in wide profile and slow motion, his 200 knights ride straight into a black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed, fast cuts of screaming orcs are shown, and throughout the above sequence, Denethor continues to eat.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Denethor persists with his repast as Faramir departs. High above Minas Morgul, on a small shelf next to the steps, recline Frodo, Sam, and Gollum. Sam observes a slumbering Gollum warily as he desperately attempts to remain conscious, but gradually, inexorably, Sam succumbs to slumber. Gollum's eyes spring open, he sits upright, and silently crawls towards Sam's bag. Sam breathes deeply now, soundly asleep. Gollum grimaces in disgust as he extracts the lembas bread and quietly scatters crumbs over the sleeping Sam before tossing the remaining lembas bread over the precipice. Sam's eyes flicker open and Gollum swivels around, taken by surprise. Too fatigued to quarrel, Sam turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder. Sam searches through his bag, seeking a morsel to consume, but halts searching, astonishment on his visage, and slowly turns to Gollum. Gollum smacks his hand against Sam's coat, sending lembas crumbs cascading down. Sam is incensed, hurls himself at Gollum, and strikes him. Frodo pulls Sam off Gollum and collapses on the terrain, with Sam's aghast expression showing. Sam attempts to tend around Frodo, but a dreadful light emerges in Frodo's eyes as he gazes into Sam's sincere eyes. Frodo shoves Sam away, clutching the ring beneath his garment, and rises to his feet as if infused with a terrifying potent energy. Sam stares at Frodo with incredulity, tears gather in his eyes, and spill down his cheeks as Frodo turns and departs with Gollum. Sam is in utter desolation. Meanwhile, Faramir guides a procession of 200 cavaliers through the avenues towards the city portal, with individuals rushing forward, tossing blossoms over the cavaliers. Gandalf hastens alongside Faramir's steed, reading the anguish in Faramir's eyes, and calls after him, attempting once more to halt the young man. From a high perspective, Faramir leads the 200 mounted cavaliers through the gates of Minas Tirith and across the Pelennor Fields towards the remnants of Osgiliath as the inhabitants of Minas Tirith observe. Faramir's cavaliers fan out to create one linear formation of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his troops watch them approach. Unexpectedly, fast shifting into Pippin, who observes as Denethor consumes, Gothmog ascends amidst the ruins. Faramir's cavaliers thunder towards the lens, 75 yards distant, and Gothmog turns to lens and elevates his hand. Behind Gothmog, 5,000 Orc archers rise to their feet, obsidian arrows already notched on their bows. Faramir shouts defiantly, but in wide outline and slow motion, his 200 cavaliers charge directly into a sepulchral barrier of flying arrows. At normal speed, rapid cuts of shrieking orcs are displayed, and throughout the aforementioned sequence, Denethor continues to consume.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Denethor's meal is continued by him as Faramir exits. Frodo, Sam, and Gollum lie on a small ledge high above Minas Morgul, next to the stairs. A sleeping Gollum is watched suspiciously by Sam as he desperately tries to stay awake, but Sam is slowly, inevitably overtaken by sleep. Gollum opens his eyes with a snap, sits up, and crawls quietly towards Sam's knapsack. Deep breathing by Sam signifies he is heavily asleep. In distaste, Gollum grimaces as the lembas bread is pulled out by him and crumbs are quietly sprinkled over Sam before the remaining lembas bread is thrown over the cliff by him. Sam's eyes are flicked open, and around spins Gollum, caught off guard. Too exhausted to argue, away is turned by Sam and Frodo's shoulder is gently shaken by him. Sam's knapsack is rummaged through by him, looking for a bite to eat, but shock shows on his face as he stops rummaging and slowly turns to Gollum. Gollum's hand is slapped against Sam's jacket by him, sending lembas crumbs raining down. Enraged, Sam throws himself at Gollum and punches him. Frodo pulls Sam off Gollum and the ground is collapsed on by him, with Sam's horrified face showing. Around Frodo, Sam attempts to fuss, but a terrible light comes into Frodo's eyes as Sam's earnest eyes are stared into by him. Away is pushed by Frodo, who clutches the ring beneath his shirt and rises to his feet, empowered with frightening intense energy. At Frodo, Sam stares with disbelief, tears welling in his eyes and spilling down his cheeks as Frodo, with Gollum, turns and leaves. Complete misery is felt by Sam. Meanwhile, a column of 200 knights is led by Faramir through the streets towards the city gate, with flowers being thrown over the knights by people rushing forward. Alongside Faramir's horse, Gandalf hurries, reading the pain in Faramir's eyes, and calls after him, trying one more time to stop the young man. From a high angle, 200 mounted knights are led by Faramir through the gates of Minas Tirith and across the Pelennor Fields towards the ruins of Osgiliath as people of Minas Tirith watch. Faramir's knights fan out to form one straight line of 200 horsemen as they are approached by Gothmog and his men. Suddenly, fast is pushed into Pippin, who looks on as Denethor eats, as Gothmog rises amidst the ruins. Towards the camera, Faramir's knights thunder, 75 yards away, and to the camera, Gothmog turns and raises his hand. Behind Gothmog, to their feet rise 5,000 Orc archers, black arrows already strung on their bows. Faramir defiantly yells, but in wide profile and slow motion, straight into a black wall of flying arrows ride his 200 knights. At normal speed, fast cuts of screaming orcs are shown, and throughout the above sequence, Denethor's eating is continued.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Denethor eats as Faramir exits. High above Minas Morgul, Frodo, Sam, and Gollum rest on a ledge beside the stairs. Sam suspiciously watches sleeping Gollum but eventually falls asleep. Gollum wakes, crawls to Sam's knapsack, and disgustedly sprinkles lembas crumbs over Sam before throwing the remaining bread over the cliff. Sam wakes, sees Gollum, and turns to Frodo. Searching for food, Sam finds nothing and looks accusingly at Gollum, who scatters crumbs over Sam. Enraged, Sam attacks Gollum. Frodo pulls Sam off, collapses, and then pushes Sam away, clutching the ring with intense energy. Tears in his eyes, Sam watches Frodo leave with Gollum, feeling devastated. Meanwhile, Faramir leads 200 knights through the city streets, with people throwing flowers. Gandalf runs beside Faramir's horse, trying to stop him. Faramir leads the knights through Minas Tirith's gates, across Pelennor Fields towards Osgiliath, as people watch. Faramir's knights form a line as Gothmog and his men watch. Suddenly, Pippin observes Denethor eating while Gothmog rises. Faramir's knights approach, and Gothmog raises his hand. Behind him, 5,000 Orc archers stand ready with arrows. Faramir defiantly charges with his knights into a barrage of black arrows. Fast cuts of screaming orcs appear, while Denethor continues to eat.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Denethor eats as Faramir exits. Above Minas Morgul, Frodo, Sam, and Gollum lie on a ledge. Sam watches a sleeping Gollum suspiciously but falls asleep. Gollum wakes, sneaks to Sam's knapsack, and sprinkles lembas crumbs on Sam before discarding the rest. Sam awakens, shocked, as Gollum frames him. Enraged, Sam attacks Gollum. Frodo pulls Sam away, empowered by the ring, and pushes Sam aside, leaving with Gollum while Sam weeps. Meanwhile, Faramir leads 200 knights through Minas Tirith as people throw flowers. Gandalf pleads with Faramir, who leads his knights to Osgiliath. They charge into a rain of arrows from 5,000 Orcs as Denethor eats.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Denethor continues eating his meal with a steady focus as Faramir resolutely exits his presence. High above the dark and foreboding fortress of Minas Morgul, perched precariously on a small ledge next to the steep, winding stairs, rest the figures of Frodo, Sam, and Gollum. Sam, battling his deep-seated suspicions, keeps a watchful eye on the quietly sleeping Gollum, fighting valiantly and desperately to remain awake. However, despite his best efforts, Sam slowly and inevitably succumbs to fatigue and falls into a deep slumber. 

At that moment, Gollum's eyes suddenly snap open. He sits up with a quick, decisive movement and begins to silently crawl over to Sam's knapsack with a sly, calculated stealth. Sam, now breathing deeply in his heavy sleep, is unaware of the surroundings. Gollum, showing a grimace of distaste, pulls out the much-valued lembas bread from the knapsack and meticulously sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam, operating with a quiet cunning. Gollum then, with a final contemptuous gesture, throws the remaining lembas bread over the sheer cliff. 

Sam's eyes flick open abruptly, and Gollum, caught off guard, spins around quickly. Too exhausted and drained to argue, Sam simply turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder, seeking comfort and companionship. As Sam rummages through his own knapsack, desperately searching for a bite to eat, he abruptly stops, his face a mask of shock and disbelief, as he slowly turns toward Gollum with an accusing glare. Gollum then slaps his hand against Sam’s jacket, causing an explosion of lembas crumbs to rain down. 

Engulfed by a surge of rage, Sam throws himself at Gollum, striking him in anger. Frodo intervenes, pulling Sam off Gollum, and collapses onto the hard ground, staring with a horrified expression at Sam. Attempting to regain his composure, Sam fusses around Frodo, but a terrible, menacing light appears in Frodo’s eyes, arresting his attention as he stares into Sam’s earnest eyes. Frodo, overwhelmed and seized by a powerful, intensely frightening energy, pushes Sam away, his hand clutching the ring beneath his shirt. He rises to his feet, empowered and transformed by the ring's dark presence.

Sam is left staring at Frodo in sheer disbelief, tears welling up in his eyes, spilling freely down his cheeks, as Frodo, without a word, turns and leaves with Gollum. Sam is enveloped in utter and complete misery, unable to comprehend the profound changes in Frodo. Meanwhile, Faramir, with a sense of duty and determination, leads a formidable column of 200 knights through the bustling streets toward the city gate, with people rushing forward, showering the brave knights with flowers. Beside Faramir’s horse, Gandalf hurries, reading the deep pain and resolve in Faramir’s eyes, calling after him in a desperate bid to stop the young man from his perilous course.

From a high vantage point, Faramir commands his 200 mounted knights through the grand gates of Minas Tirith and across the vast expanse of the Pelennor Fields toward the desolate ruins of Osgiliath as the anxious people of Minas Tirith watch with bated breath. Faramir’s knights adeptly fan out, forming an unwavering straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his brutal forces watch their approach with calculated anticipation. Suddenly, the camera pushes fast towards Pippin, who looks on anxiously as Denethor continues to eat, while Gothmog rises powerfully amidst the ruins. 

Faramir’s knights thunder resolutely toward the camera, merely 75 yards away, and Gothmog, with a deliberate motion, turns to the camera and raises his hand, signaling his army. Behind Gothmog, an imposing force of 5,000 Orc archers rise to their feet, their black arrows already strung taut on their bows, ready to unleash destruction. Faramir, with a defiant yell, leads his men, but in wide profile and captured in slow motion, his 200 knights charge bravely into a relentless, impenetrable black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed, rapid cuts of screaming orcs are shown in quick succession, heightening tension, and throughout the intense, harrowing sequence, Denethor continues to eat, indifferent and absorbed.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Denethor continues to eat his meal with unwavering focus, his attention never wavering as Faramir, filled with resolute determination, exits from his presence. Far above the dark and ominous fortress of Minas Morgul, perched precariously on a small ledge next to the steep, winding stairs, rest the figures of Frodo, Sam, and Gollum. Sam, struggling with his deeply ingrained suspicions, keeps a vigilant and watchful eye on Gollum, who appears to be quietly sleeping. Sam battles valiantly, fighting desperately to stay awake and alert. However, despite his best efforts, Sam gradually and inevitably succumbs to the overwhelming tide of fatigue and slips into a deep slumber. 

At that very moment, Gollum's eyes snap open suddenly. He sits up with a swift, decisive movement and begins to silently crawl over to Sam's knapsack, employing sly and calculated stealth. Sam, now breathing deeply in his heavy sleep, remains unaware of his surroundings. Gollum, showing a grimace of distaste, pulls out the much-valued lembas bread from the knapsack and meticulously sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam, operating with quiet, cunning precision. Gollum then, with a final contemptuous gesture, throws the remaining lembas bread over the sheer cliff. 

Sam's eyes flick open abruptly, and Gollum, caught off guard, spins around quickly. Too exhausted and drained to argue, Sam simply turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder, seeking comfort and companionship. As Sam rummages through his own knapsack, desperately searching for something to eat, he abruptly stops, his face a mask of shock and disbelief, as he slowly turns toward Gollum with an accusing glare. Gollum then slaps his hand against Sam’s jacket, causing an explosion of lembas crumbs to rain down. 

Overcome by a surge of anger and frustration, Sam throws himself at Gollum, striking him in a fit of rage. Frodo, witnessing the altercation, intervenes by pulling Sam away from Gollum and collapses onto the hard ground, staring with a horrified expression at Sam. Attempting to regain his composure, Sam fusses around Frodo, but a terrible, menacing light appears in Frodo’s eyes, capturing his attention as he stares directly into Sam’s earnest eyes. Frodo, overwhelmed and seized by a powerful and intensely frightening energy, pushes Sam away, his hand tightly clutching the ring beneath his shirt. He rises to his feet, empowered and transformed by the ring's dark presence.

Sam is left standing there, gazing at Frodo in sheer disbelief, tears welling up in his eyes and spilling freely down his cheeks, as Frodo, without uttering a single word, turns and departs with Gollum. Sam is wrapped in utter and complete misery, unable to comprehend and make sense of the profound changes that have taken hold of Frodo. Meanwhile, Faramir, with a sense of duty and determination, leads a formidable column of 200 knights through the bustling and vibrant streets toward the city gate, where people rush forward to shower the brave knights with flowers. Beside Faramir’s horse, Gandalf hurries alongside, reading the deep pain and resolve in Faramir’s eyes, calling after him in a desperate bid to stop the young man from his perilous course.

From a high vantage point, Faramir commands his 200 mounted knights through the grand, imposing gates of Minas Tirith and across the vast expanse of the Pelennor Fields, heading toward the desolate ruins of Osgiliath as the anxious people of Minas Tirith watch with bated breath. Faramir’s knights skillfully fan out, forming an unwavering straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his brutal forces watch their approach with calculated anticipation. Suddenly, the camera pushes swiftly toward Pippin, who looks on anxiously as Denethor continues to eat, while Gothmog rises powerfully amidst the ruins.

Faramir’s knights thunder resolutely toward the camera, a mere 75 yards away, and Gothmog, with a deliberate and purposeful motion, turns to the camera, raising his hand to signal his army. Behind Gothmog, an imposing force of 5,000 Orc archers rise to their feet, their black arrows already strung taut on their bows, fully prepared to unleash destruction. Faramir, with a defiant yell, leads his men, but captured in wide profile and slow motion, his 200 knights charge bravely into a relentless, impenetrable black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed, rapid cuts of screaming orcs are shown in quick succession, further heightening the tension, and throughout this intense, harrowing sequence, Denethor continues to eat, indifferent and absorbed.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Denethor remains seated, continuing with his meal, unbothered, as Faramir silently makes his exit from the room. In a stark contrast to the scene in Minas Tirith, high above Minas Morgul, Frodo, Sam, and Gollum are situated precariously on a small ledge that lies adjacent to the winding stairs. Sam casts a wary eye over the sleeping Gollum, his suspicion ever-present as he fights the overwhelming urge to succumb to fatigue, but despite his efforts, sleep overcomes him slowly but surely. As Sam drifts into a deeper slumber, Gollum's eyes snap open abruptly, filled with a cunning alertness. He smoothly sits up and, with calculated stealth, begins to crawl quietly towards Sam's knapsack, motivated by a hidden agenda. Sam, now entirely asleep, breathes deeply and heavily, a testament to his exhaustion. Gollum grimaces with distaste as he extracts the lembas bread from the bag, and with quiet precision, he sprinkles crumbs over the unsuspecting Sam before coldly disposing of the remaining lembas over the cliff's edge. Sam's eyes flutter open just in time to see Gollum spin around, startled by Sam's waking gaze. Sam, too exhausted to mount a verbal defense, simply turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder, seeking his attention. As Sam begins to rummage through his own knapsack in search of something to sate his hunger, he abruptly halts, shock etched across his features, and he slowly pivots his gaze towards Gollum. Gollum, quick to act, slaps his hand against Sam's jacket, causing crumbs of lembas to cascade down conspicuously. Enraged by this revelation, Sam launches himself at Gollum in a fit of anger and lands a firm punch. Frodo, caught up in the escalating tension, intervenes by pulling Sam off Gollum, but collapses on the ground immediately afterward, leaving Sam to stare, horror-stricken, at the scene that has just unfolded. Despite Sam's attempts to fuss over Frodo, a menacing light ignites in Frodo's eyes as he meets Sam's earnest gaze, and he forcefully pushes Sam away, clutching the ring securely beneath his shirt as if it grants him power. Rising to his feet, Frodo appears imbued with an intense, frightening energy that propels him forward. Sam, left in disbelief, watches Frodo with eyes filled with unshed tears that soon spill down his cheeks, defeated as Frodo turns and departs with Gollum, leaving Sam in the depth of misery. Meanwhile, with determined resolve, Faramir leads a column of 200 knights through the bustling streets towards the city gate, as enthusiastic townspeople eagerly rush forward, showering them with flowers. Gandalf, perceiving the pain etched on Faramir's face, moves briskly alongside Faramir's horse, calling out to him in a last effort to dissuade the young captain from his mission. As the scene shifts to a high vantage point, Faramir gallantly leads his 200 mounted knights through the great gates of Minas Tirith and across the expansive Pelennor Fields, their destination the battered ruins of Osgiliath, as the people stand vigil, watching intently. In a display of martial precision, Faramir's knights maneuver into a single, unbroken line of 200 horsemen, even as Gothmog and his men scrutinize their approach. The camera rapidly shifts focus to Pippin, who looks on anxiously as Denethor continues to eat, seemingly oblivious to the impending confrontation. Amidst the ruins, Gothmog rises, his presence ominous, as Faramir's knights charge forward relentlessly, now only 75 yards from the camera's view. Gothmog turns decisively to face the camera, raising his hand in an authoritative gesture. Behind him, a formidable force of 5,000 Orc archers rises in unison, their black arrows already strung on their bows, poised and ready. Faramir bellows defiantly into the fray, but as the scene shifts to slow motion, his 200 valiant knights ride headlong into a barrage of flying arrows, a metaphorical black wall of impending doom. The pace quickens, and rapid cuts capture the chaos of screaming orcs, the battle cries mingling with the relentless advance, while throughout this escalating tension, Denethor remains steadfast, continuing his meal, unaffected by the tumult unfolding.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Denethor continues his meal as Faramir exits. High above Minas Morgul, Frodo, Sam, and Gollum lie on a ledge. As Sam struggles to stay awake, he eventually falls asleep beside the watchful Gollum. Seizing the opportunity, Gollum sneaks to Sam's knapsack, removes the lembas bread, spreads crumbs over Sam, and discards the remaining bread over the cliff. Sam awakens to find Gollum pretending innocence. Too weary to confront him, Sam turns to Frodo, seeking food. Shocked by the missing lembas, Sam glares at Gollum, who then shakes crumbs onto him. Enraged, Sam attacks Gollum, prompting Frodo to intervene. Frodo's intense demeanor causes him to push Sam away as he clutches the ring. Disbelieving, Sam watches Frodo depart with Gollum, tears streaming down his face, in complete despair. Meanwhile, Faramir leads 200 knights through the streets towards the city gate, showered with flowers by the people. Gandalf, perceiving Faramir's pain, attempts to dissuade him, but the young man continues. Faramir's knights exit Minas Tirith, advancing across the Pelennor Fields towards Osgiliath, observed by the citizens. The knights form a line as Gothmog and his forces watch. Against the backdrop of an advancing 5,000 Orc archers, Faramir’s knights charge forward, colliding with a barrage of arrows in slow motion as Denethor continues to eat, oblivious to the unfolding battle.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Denethor, the steward of Gondor known for his deep despair and obstinance, continues with his meal as Faramir exits. High above Minas Morgul, the fearsome stronghold of the Ringwraiths, on a small ledge next to the stairs, lie Frodo, Sam, and Gollum. Sam, ever vigilant and distrustful of their treacherous companion, watches a sleeping Gollum suspiciously as he desperately tries to stay awake, but slowly, inevitably, Sam falls asleep. Gollum's eyes snap open, he sits up, and quietly crawls towards Sam's knapsack. Sam breathes deeply now, heavily asleep. Gollum grimaces in distaste as he pulls out the lembas bread, an elvish waybread known for its sustenance on long journeys, and quietly sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam before throwing the remaining lembas bread over the cliff. Sam's eyes flick open and Gollum spins around, caught off guard. Too exhausted to argue, Sam turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder. Sam rummages through his knapsack, looking for a bite to eat, but stops rummaging, shock on his face, and slowly turns to Gollum. Gollum slaps his hand against Sam's jacket, sending lembas crumbs raining down. Sam is enraged, throws himself at Gollum, and punches him. Frodo pulls Sam off Gollum and collapses on the ground, with Sam's horrified face showing. Sam attempts to fuss around Frodo, but a terrible light comes into Frodo's eyes, a sign of the Ring's growing influence over him, as he stares into Sam's earnest eyes. Frodo pushes Sam away, clutching the ring beneath his shirt, a powerful artifact that corrupts its bearer, and rises to his feet as if empowered with a frightening intense energy. Sam stares at Frodo with disbelief, tears well in his eyes, and spill down his cheeks as Frodo turns and leaves with Gollum. Sam is in complete misery. Meanwhile, Faramir leads a column of 200 knights through the streets towards the city gate, with people rushing forward, throwing flowers over the knights, a traditional gesture of support for soldiers heading to battle. Gandalf, the wise and powerful wizard tasked with aiding Middle-earth in its struggle against darkness, hurries alongside Faramir's horse, reading the pain in Faramir's eyes, and calls after him, trying one more time to stop the young man from what seems a futile mission. From a high angle, Faramir leads the 200 mounted knights through the gates of Minas Tirith, the last stronghold of men, and across the Pelennor Fields towards the ruins of Osgiliath, a once-great city now devastated by war, as the people of Minas Tirith watch. Faramir's knights fan out to form one straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog, the ruthless lieutenant of Sauron's forces, and his men watch them approach. Suddenly, fast pushing into Pippin, who looks on as Denethor eats, Gothmog rises amidst the ruins. Faramir's knights thunder towards the camera, 75 yards away, and Gothmog turns to camera and raises his hand. Behind Gothmog, 5,000 Orc archers rise to their feet, black arrows already strung on their bows, ready to unleash a deadly volley. Faramir yells defiantly, but in wide profile and slow motion, his 200 knights ride straight into a black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed, fast cuts of screaming orcs are shown, and throughout the above sequence, Denethor continues to eat, oblivious to the tragedy unfolding.

Sam breathes deeply now heavily asleep. Gollum grimaces in distaste as he pulls out the lembas bread and quietly sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam before throwing the remaining lembas bread over the cliff. Sam attempts to fuss around Frodo but a terrible light comes into Frodo's eyes as he stares into Sam's earnest eyes. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Frodo pushes Sam away clutching the ring beneath his shirt and rises to his feet as if empowered with a frightening intense energy. Sam stares at Frodo with disbelief tears well in his eyes and spill down his cheeks as Frodo turns and leaves with Gollum. Sam is in complete misery. Meanwhile Faramir leads a column of 200 knights through the streets towards the city gate with people rushing forward throwing flowers over the knights. Gandalf hurries alongside Faramir's horse reading the pain in Faramir's eyes and calls after him trying one more time to stop the young man. From a high angle Faramir leads the 200 mounted knights through the gates of Minas Tirith and across the Pelennor Fields towards the ruins of Osgiliath. as the people of Minas Tirith watch Faramir's knights fan out to form one straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his men watch them approach. Suddenly fast pushing into Pippin who looks on as Denethor eats. Gothmog rises amidst the ruins. Faramir's knights thunder towards the camera 75 yards away and Gothmog turns to camera and raises his hand. Behind Gothmog 5000 Orc archers rise to their feet. black arrows already strung on their bows. Faramir yells defiantly but in wide profile and slow motion his 200 knights ride straight into a black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed fast cuts of screaming orcs are shown and throughout the above sequence Denethor continues to eat.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Denethor continues with his meal as Faramir exits High above Minas Morgul. on a small ledge next to the stairs lie Frodo Sam and Gollum. Sam watches a sleeping Gollum suspiciously as he desperately tries to stay awake but slowly inevitably Sam falls asleep. Gollum's eyes snap open. he sits up and quietly crawls towards Sam's knapsack. Sam breathes deeply now heavily asleep. Gollum grimaces in distaste as he pulls out the lembas bread and quietly sprinkles crumbs over the sleeping Sam before throwing the remaining lembas bread over the cliff. Sam's eyes flick open and Gollum spins around caught off guard. Too exhausted to argue Sam turns away and gently shakes Frodo's shoulder. Sam rummages through his knapsack looking for a bite to eat but stops rummaging shock on his face and slowly turns to Gollum. Gollum slaps his hand against Sam's jacket sending lembas crumbs raining down. Sam is enraged throws himself at Gollum and punches him. Frodo pulls Sam off Gollum and collapses on the ground with Sam's horrified face showing. Sam attempts to fuss around Frodo but a terrible light comes into Frodo's eyes as he stares into Sam's earnest eyes. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Frodo pushes Sam away clutching the ring beneath his shirt and rises to his feet as if empowered with a frightening intense energy. Sam stares at Frodo with disbelief tears well in his eyes and spill down his cheeks as Frodo turns and leaves with Gollum. Sam is in complete misery. Meanwhile Faramir leads a column of 200 knights through the streets towards the city gate with people rushing forward throwing flowers over the knights. Gandalf hurries alongside Faramir's horse reading the pain in Faramir's eyes and calls after him trying one more time to stop the young man. From a high angle Faramir leads the 200 mounted knights through the gates of Minas Tirith and across the Pelennor Fields towards the ruins of Osgiliath. as the people of Minas Tirith watch Faramir's knights fan out to form one straight line of 200 horsemen as Gothmog and his men watch them approach. Suddenly fast pushing into Pippin who looks on as Denethor eats. Gothmog rises amidst the ruins. Faramir's knights thunder towards the camera 75 yards away and Gothmog turns to camera and raises his hand. Behind Gothmog 5000 Orc archers rise to their feet. black arrows already strung on their bows. Faramir yells defiantly but in wide profile and slow motion his 200 knights ride straight into a black wall of flying arrows. At normal speed fast cuts of screaming orcs are shown and throughout the above sequence Denethor continues to eat.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Boromir skips with his dessert as Legolas vanishes. Deep within Mordor's valley, on a wide balcony next to the ladders, rest Merry, Pippin, and Smaug. Pippin observes a snoring dragon cautiously as he eagerly attempts to remain alert, but gradually, unavoidably, Pippin drifts into slumber. Smaug's wings flap wide, he stands up, and quietly glides towards Pippin's backpack. Pippin snores softly now, profoundly asleep. Smaug sneers with disdain as he pulls out the cheese biscuits and quietly scatters crumbs over the snoozing Pippin before tossing the remaining cheese biscuits into the abyss. Pippin's eyes pop open and Smaug twirls around, taken by surprise. Too weary to protest, Pippin turns away and softly pats Merry's elbow. Pippin digs through his satchel, searching for a crumb to munch, but halts his search, shock on his face, and slowly turns to Smaug. Smaug smacks his claw against Pippin's coat, sending biscuit crumbs cascading down. Pippin is furious, flings himself at Smaug, and kicks him. Merry hauls Pippin off Smaug and collapses on the ground, with Pippin's astonished face revealing. Pippin attempts to fuss around Merry, but a dreadful glow ignites in Merry's gaze as he glares into Pippin's genuine eyes. Merry nudges Pippin away, grasping the trinket beneath his vest, and stands as if charged with a daunting fierce vigor. Pippin gawks at Merry with disbelief, tears rise in his eyes, and cascade down his cheeks as Merry turns and departs with Smaug. Pippin is in utter despair. Meanwhile, Legolas guides a procession of 200 elves through the forests towards the mountain pass, with animals bounding forward, tossing leaves over the elves. Aragorn dashes alongside Legolas's stag, interpreting the sorrow in Legolas's eyes, and shouts after him, trying once more to halt the youthful leader. From a lofty vantage, Legolas guides the 200 mounted elves through the gates of Lothlórien and across the Enchanted Glades towards the fragments of Helm's Deep as the elves of Lothlórien observe. Legolas's elves spread out to form one unbroken line of 200 riders as Sauron and his creatures watch them draw near. Suddenly, briskly pivoting into Merry, who gazes on as Boromir feasts, Sauron emerges amidst the debris. Legolas's elves gallop towards the view, 75 meters away, and Sauron pivots to view and lifts his palm. Behind Sauron, 5,000 troll archers rise to their feet, crimson arrows already nocked on their bows. Legolas shouts defiantly, but in broad aspect and slow motion, his 200 elves charge directly into a dark wave of shooting arrows. At normal speed, rapid clips of screeching trolls are depicted, and throughout the above scene, Boromir persists in consuming.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Denethor continues eating as Faramir departs. High above Minas Morgul, Frodo, Sam, and Gollum lie on a ledge. Sam watches Gollum suspiciously but falls asleep. Gollum stealthily sprinkles lembas crumbs on Sam before discarding the remaining bread. Sam awakens, catching Gollum off guard. Too tired to argue, Sam attempts to eat, but Gollum's deception is revealed. Enraged, Sam attacks Gollum. Frodo intervenes, pulling them apart, and rejects Sam, clutching the ring with intense energy. Sam is heartbroken as Frodo departs with Gollum. Meanwhile, Faramir leads 200 knights through Minas Tirith's streets, showered with flowers. Despite Gandalf's attempt to stop him, Faramir leads the knights towards Osgiliath. The knights line up as Gothmog observes. Suddenly, as Denethor continues to eat, 5,000 Orc archers rise, firing at Faramir's charging knights, resulting in a dramatic and tragic clash.
